issue.title: Check returned value of fopen()
issue.body:
[util.cpp#L216](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/blob/master/src/util.cpp#L216) 
if `fopen `failed, a null file pointer could be passed to `FileWriteStr(vMsgsBeforeOpenLog->front(), fileout);`

rename.from: checks of returned value of fopen
rename.to: Check of returned value of fopen()

rename.from: Check of returned value of fopen()

events.body: As I've understood the problem, the solution would be simply passing a "NULL" to FileWriteStr as the second argument and an empty string as the first argument. Is that correct or did you have something else in mind?
I'd say the most straightforward and correct solution is to put everything until the `delete vMsgsBeforeOpenLog` under the `if (fileout)` conditional.

issue.title: Fix Issue #9775 (Check returned value of fopen)
issue.body:
Making sure file is opened before writing string to file to avoid seg faults in case open() returns a NULL pointer. 

Attempts to fix #9775

issue.title: Save watch only key timestamps when reimporting keys
issue.body:
Previously if an existing watch only key was reimported with a new timestamp,
the new timestamp would not be saved in the key metadata, and would not be used
to update the wallet nTimeFirstKey value (which could cause rescanning to start
at the wrong point and miss transactions).

Issue was pointed out by @jonasschnelli in
https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/9108#issuecomment-279715550

issue.title: Unify CWalletTx construction
issue.body:
Two commits:

- `Construct CWalletTx objects in CommitTransaction` moves a bunch of CWalletTx initialization into CWallet::CommitTransaction to dedup some code and avoid future inconsistencies in how wallet transactions are created.
- `Get rid of CWalletTx default constructor` does what is described and eliminates the possibility of empty transaction entries being inadvertently created by mapWallet[hash] accesses.

Both of these changes were originally part of #9381

issue.title: [wallet] [refactor] Simplify getbalance implementation
Factor out CWallet::nTimeSmart computation into a method.
issue.body:
No change in behavior, this change just pulls some code out of
CWallet::AddToWallet that was making it very long into a separate method.

A followup commit also adds documentation describing `CWallet::GetTimeSmart` and `CWalletTx::nTimeSmart`

issue.title: Let wallet importmulti RPC accept labels for standard scriptPubKeys
issue.body: Allow importmulti RPC to apply address labels when importing standard scriptPubKeys. This makes the importmulti RPC less finnicky about import formats and also simpler internally.
